title: Flag: Central African Republic

adjectives: From or in the countryside or connected with it.
Of, from or pertaining to the countryside (adjective).
Of or relating to the nations of Africa or their peoples
nouns: A native of Africa; also one ethnologically belonging to an African race.
A native of Africa or ethnologically belonging to an African race.
A native of Africa.
A native or inhabitant of Africa
Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
Piece of cloth.
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design
The flag of the Central African Republic was adopted on December 1, 1958.
The Central African Republic is a landlocked country in Central Africa.
A country in Central Africa whose capital is Bangui.
A region in the centre of Africa continent, also known as Middle Africa
2-letter ISO country code
Central African Republic
A landlocked country in central Africa; formerly under French control; became independent in 1960
A geographic region of the African continent close to the equator that includes Cameroon, Chad, Equatorial Guinea, Gabon, the Central African Republic and the Democratic Republic of Congo.
Core region of the African continent
Country in Central Africa. Official name: Central African Republic.
Central African Republic is a landlocked country in Central Africa. African Republic
Country in Central Africa.
A core region of the African continent which includes Burundi, the Central African Republic, Chad, Democratic Republic of the Congo, and Rwanda.
Central Africa is a core region of the African continent which includes Burundi, the Central African Republic, Chad, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, and Rwanda.
The opposite of secession
As its original Latin term
Government
The collective body of a nation or state as politically organized, or as exercising political functions.
The territory of a nation, especially an independent nation state or formerly independent nation; a political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

Nations is often used synonymously with ethnic group, but although ethnicity is now one of the most important aspects of cultural or social identity for the members of most nations, people with the same ethnic origin may live in different nation-states and be treated as members of separate nations for that reason.
Political organisation with a centralized independent government
The government.
An organized political community, living under a government
Nation has various meanings, and the meaning has changed over time.
A state is an organized community living under one government.
A political entity asserting ultimate authority over a geographical area.

A people permanently occupying a fixed territory bound together by common law, habits and custom into one body politic exercising, through the medium of an organized government, independent sovereignty and control over all persons and things within its boundaries, unless or until authority is ceded to a federation or union of other states.
The people who live in a nation or country
A politically organized body of people under a single government
A sovereign state.
A state is a nonphysical juridical entity of the international legal system that is represented by one centralized government that has supreme independent authority over a geographic area.
The geographic area under the control of a political state.

description: The flag for Central African Republic, which may show as the letters CF on some platforms.
apple_vendor_description: The flag of the Central African Republic, as depicted on Apple devices, is a vibrant and precise representation, showcasing Apple's commitment to detail with sharp lines and smooth color transitions.  The iconic blue, white, red, and green stripes, along with the yellow star, are rendered with a subtle 3D effect and realistic lighting that gives the flag a dignified presence.  This emoji, appearing with its characteristic boldness on Apple devices, is used to express national pride, geographical location, or to signify events related to the Central African Republic.
